Full Job Description HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?

At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.

YOUR ROLE
As an IT Web Developer Intern, May 2022 – August 2022, you will:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and define project goals
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, digital products, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Become part of a Global DevOps team by building prototypes and take part in all stages of the product lifecycle from analysis to release
Apply your knowledge to build and develop new user-facing experiences writing reusable code and libraries
Expand your skills in A/B testing framework to improve user experiences and website optimization
YOUR SKILLS
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in a Computer Science or related discipline OR have completed your studies no more than 6 months prior to the start of the internship, with a GPA of 3.2 •
Able to intern full-time beginning May through August 2022 with the opportunity for an extension if desired •
Proficiency with two or more programming languages – Java, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Understanding around concepts like Web Services, SOA, REST APIs
Collaborating and working within Agile Teams to translate user stories into technology solutions by creating designs, functional specifications, test plans, and test cases
Analytical and problem-solving skills: ability to analyze data and develop fact-based recommendations resulting from the analysis
Communication skills: a collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and can-do attitude
The salary range for this role is $43,860 to $62,400. This is the range that we in good faith anticipate relying on when setting wages for this position. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Connecticut. This salary range may also be modified in the future.

Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.

Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel’s request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.

All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.

Contract & Job type: Full Time, Limited Term
Contact information for application-related questions: 1-866-836-7067

Full Job Description Position: STEM Education Internship Location: Lake Charles, LA Position description Learning Undefeated is seeking passionate and enthusiastic individuals to join its Lake Charles, LA based mobile laboratory teams. These innovative learning spaces offer schools and community partners teaching space, classroom resources, and captivating STEM learning experiences. Drop Anywhere LabsTM offers a one-of-a-kind environment and uses touchscreen walls, tablets, and projection mapping to immerse participants in an interactive learning environment. These custom outfitted STEM learning spaces are built inside a shipping container (Drop Anywhere Lab) that travel to a different school each week. The mobile laboratories offer a blend of career and skills education, providing flexible in-classroom resources that empower teachers. The Drop Anywhere Lab and will mostly serve Calcasieu Parish schools in the Spring of 2022. The STEM Education Intern’s primary responsibilities include presenting motivating and engaging STEM experiences onboard the Drop Anywhere Lab. Individuals will also assist in the development of programs and curriculum, coordinating school and community partner visits, and supporting the management of equipment, supplies, and technology for the program. The STEM Education Interns are the face of Learning Undefeated’s programming and will have the opportunity to impact thousands of Calcasieu Parish students personally. This is an incredible opportunity to be part of a team that is changing how STEM education is delivered, with a specific focus on underserved communities. The ideal team member will be high-energy, creative, flexible, solutions- oriented, and able to handle rapidly changing circumstances with grace. In return, we offer an unparalleled opportunity to be part of the next big thing in STEM education and an entrepreneurial work environment that supports individual success. Responsibilities include: Serve as a positive, flexible, solutions-oriented member of a fast-paced team Facilitate age-appropriate STEM activities and extended or enrichment opportunities to students, both onboard the mobile laboratory and in the classroom Staff after-school events, such as family science night, and public events, such as conferences, festivals, and sporting events Assist with development of curriculum, activities, and materials for middle and high school students and teachers in accordance with the Louisiana State Standards Position requirements: Must have completed a minimum of 24 hours of undergraduate coursework Must have completed at least sixteen (16) credits of undergraduate classwork in STEM related fields (e.g Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science) Outstanding customer service skills, a friendly, outgoing attitude, and the ability to work well as part of a team Must be flexible and adapt well in unpredictable situations Excellent organizational and communication skills Must be able to provide reliable transportation to/from school locations Must be able to report to a different school in Calcasieu Parish every two weeks Demonstrated commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment Must be able to pass a childcare background check Proof of COVID-19 vaccination required Hours and Compensation Must be able to work 30-35 hours/week (Monday-Friday) Must be able to work shifts on a school schedule (7AM- 4PM) Hourly rate is $15/hour The fine print This is a 30-35 hr/week . This is a full-time, 6-month position. Hourly rate is $15/hr. The candidate will be selected for hire based on the following criteria: education, experience, subject area of expertise, communication skills, professional references, background check, and availability. This position reports to the Texas Regional Director. Learning Undefeated embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. About Learning Undefeated, Inc. Learning Undefeated, Inc. is a non-profit organization that brings life-changing STEM education and career opportunities to underserved communities. Through innovative and experiential education programs for grades K-12, we are sparking interest in STEM careers, building the workforce that will drive the innovation economy, and bridging school, community, health, and business. Learning Undefeated interdisciplinary approach uses STEM to explore real-world, problem-centric curriculum that bridges school, community, health, and business. Learning Undefeated operates innovative and successful mobile STEM education programs in the mid-Atlantic region and Texas. Since 2003, Learning Undefeated mobile STEM education programs have served more than one million students across 50 states. Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary, Internship Pay: $15.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekend availability COVID-19 considerations: Proof of COVID-19 vaccination required; Face masks are required when working on lab or in the classroom License/Certification: Driver's License (Required) Shift availability: Day Shift (Required) Work Location: Multiple Locations

position: Coding - Minecraft - Robotics Teacher (Internships) STEM Summer Camps
description: Full Job Description Coding - Minecraft - Robotics Teacher (Internships) STEM Summer Camps ABOUT PROGRAM: We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions! Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout Minnesota. We offer Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics classes for students ages 6-14. Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers. Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom. Many of our past employees were able to use our positions to satisfy internship requirements. You must be available for eight weeks this summer, from June 6 to August 12. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8am to 4pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both. As a teacher or assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need a vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. Training and Equipment: Before teaching or assisting, teachers complete 12 hours of online training on essential camp management and leadership skills and then complete an in-house 12-hour employee orientation. We provided all the equipment and curriculum needed to teach classes. Pay: Teachers: $16-$30 an hour Assistants $12-$16 an hour Prep and training: $10.50 an hour Requirements: College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education Excellent Communication Skills Experience with Elementary age children Have a valid driver’s license You will be required to complete a local and national background check Be very comfortable with technology and using computers A reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds You must be very punctual and reliable. Be organized and efficient to run an effective class You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us regularly Patient, positive personality Plusses: Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, Programming, or Robotics experience Background in tutoring/coaching kids Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Internship Pay: $16.00 - $30.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Day shift Application Question(s): City, State you will be living in during the summer of 2022? Position Applying For (Teacher or Assistant) Highest Year of Schooling Completed by the Summer of 2022: (or Diploma/Degree if not currently a student) What is your experience with children? Group size? Where you alone or with other staff? What age groups have you worked with? Do you have any experience using photo-editing or video-editing software? If so, please describe: Do you have any experience using Minecraft, Java, Python? Please explain in detail. What is your experience with Legos or Robotics? Please explain in detail. If you are in school, have other commitments, or are currently working, are there hours or dates that you will not be available? What was appealing about this position that made you want to apply? Experience: Childcare: 1 year (Preferred) License/Certification: Driver's License (Required) Work Location: Multiple Locations

Full Job Description The Picas Group is looking for an information technology (IT) intern with a passion for technology, collaboration, and creative problem-solving. The intern will actively contribute to meaningful projects and work closely with the IT team. IT Intern Duties & Responsibilities · Perform customer database checkups · Monitor & manage IT infrastructure · Deploy updates to Picas software · Complete billable IT work for customers as appropriate · Help integrate with 3rd party applications · Communicate with customer IT departments · Assist with backing up and securing company/customer data · Research and implement new IT processes · Perform server maintenance and updates · Troubleshoot issues and provide technical support to customers and company staff · Create and maintain internal and customer-facing documentation · Other projects/duties as assigned Requirements · Pursuing a degree – or have existing experience – with computer science, information technology, or related IT fields · Proficiency with computers and technology · Desire to learn and assist the company and our customers · Strong verbal and written communication · Analytical and problem-solving skills · Ability to work well in teams · Strong work ethic and attention to detail · Ability to work at our Grand Rapids office · Knowledge of databases, SQL, PowerShell, Benefits · Gain hands-on experience in a paid IT position · Shadowing and training experiences with developers and technicians · Flexible schedule for students, with 10-30 hours of work per week · Work on a wide variety of IT projects; we’ll try to assign projects based on what you want to learn · Documentation can be provided for college/university internship credit Job Types: Part-time, Internship Pay: $15.00 - $21.00 per hour Ability to commute/relocate: Grand Rapids, MI 49525: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: database, SQL, and PowerShell: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Full Job Description reqid: 100514

HALLMARK - WHEN YOU CARE ENOUGH YOU CAN CHANGE THE WORLD.

Come join us. You’ll add value to one of the world’s most iconic consumer brands and be part of our company with a life-affirming purpose to inspire meaningful connections. Our products, content and experiences aim to enrich all lives by making a genuine difference in every life, every day, and our business is focused on bringing the value and relevance of Diversity and Inclusion to every brand, product and person we touch. Our overarching enterprise D&I Framework and plans demonstrate our belief and value in having an diverse and inclusive workforce. Hallmark’s D&I efforts will continue to represent ongoing progress and reinforce our commitment, as will our intentional focus on bringing more diverse talent into our business and onto our teams. Hallmark has been recognized as one of Forbes and Statista 2020 as:

America’s Best Employers for Diversity America’s Best Employers for Women America’s Best-in-State Employers America’s Best Employers for New Graduates
ABOUT HALLMARK’S INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

We need sharp, energetic people to help us create, engineer, market, and deliver our products worldwide. Challenging summer internship opportunities are available for candidates pursuing degrees in areas such as Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain Management, Economics, Communications, Engineering, Human Resources, Psychology, Statistics, Physics, Data Science, and Computer Science.

Hallmark’s internship program (typically late May through early August) provides the valuable opportunity to apply your classroom knowledge to meaningful projects in a corporate environment. You not only work on meaningful projects tied to Hallmark business objectives, but you will also gain exposure to Hallmark leadership, learn more about products and initiatives, visit with employees and interns from other disciplines, and enjoy what life is like in Kansas City. Never been to Kansas City? You’ve been missing out on the city that is consistently ranked among the best in terms of culture, livability, and opportunity for recent college grads! Check out www.thinkkc.com for more information on living and working in Kansas City.

AN OVERVIEW

The Data Science Intern will perform data analyses to derive insight, patterns, and correlations from Hallmark’s data and other external data that can inform revenue growth opportunities, identify cost avoidance opportunities, and shape strategy. Analysis will include applying quantitative data methods, database development , some data mining techniques. The analyses will need to be translated into key insights and interpretive summaries where easily interpreted by decision makers leveraging a variety of visual approaches. Past intern projects have included:

Building out automated modeling technology to quickly predict future behavior of millions of consumers.
NLP work on analyzing text data inside the Hallmark writing collection to label it with tone and predictive attributes.
Predicting product category cross-propensities.

In addition, our interns will work with various technologies which may include Java, JavaScript, Visual Basic, C/C++, .net, Python, R, Teradata, SAP, AWS, Docker, MySQL, MSSQL, PySpark, Amazon Sagemaker, Amazon Athena, TensorFlow, NGINX, PyTorch, and mobile applications.

Interested? Follow the application instructions below to apply.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:
You must show how you meet the basic qualifications (listed below) in a resume or document you upload, or by completing the work experience and education application fields. Accepted file types are Microsoft Word (DOC or DOCX), PDF, HTML, or TXT.

In compliance with the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, Hallmark Cards, Inc. and its subsidiary companies will hire only individuals lawfully authorized to work in the United States. Hallmark does not generally provide sponsorship for employment. Employment by Hallmark is contingent upon the signing of the Employment Agreement, signing of an agreement to arbitrate in connection with the Hallmark Dispute Resolution Program, completing Form I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification, passing the urinalysis drug screen, education verification and satisfactory reference and background checks.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

The following is required to be considered for this role:
Pursuing a masters degree or higher with a graduation date of December 2022 or later.
Minimum GPA of 3.0 (must be stated on your resume).
Experience using at least one of the following: Python, R, or SQL.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Your resume and application will stand out if you have:
Pursuing a degree in a quantitative discipline – Statistics, Math, Engineering, Economics, Data Science, or Computer Science.
Applied experience using at least 2 of the following: Python, R, or SQL.
Minimum GPA of 3.5 in major (must be stated on your resume).
Strong curiosity and learning agility.
Demonstrated application of analytics skills.
Working knowledge of Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Permanent authorization to work in the United States without company sponsorship preferred.

Additional Details

This internship will occur summer of 2022 (typically late May through early August) and may occur virtually. The intern program at Hallmark is the primary source for entry-level full-time hires either directly after graduation or for future pipeline. Full-time hiring decisions are based on performance and business need.

The final deadline for all applications is November 30th, 2021, and we plan to have all decisions made by Thanksgiving. We sincerely appreciate your interest in our program! #internhallmarklife

Hallmark is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, national origin, physical or mental disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or any other legally-protected status. Principals only please.

Full Job Description We are developing world leading game-based military simulations for major NATO powers and their allies. We are constantly looking for ways to advance the whole industry, using the latest technologies and trends (such as whole world simulation, virtual reality and motion tracking).

We are looking for a highly motivated individual with a strong background utilizing computational geometry, geospatial data, and visualization. The successful applicant will work with TerraSim software engineers to develop extensions to our existing applications for the processing of geospatial data for the use in military simulation and training applications. You will work on software products through the whole life cycle of design, implementation, testing, and documentation. These tasks will provide experience with practical application of software engineering techniques and development practices. Successful candidate must be willing and able to obtain a security clearance.

Key Requirements

Enrollment in a Computer Science bachelor’s or master’s program
Excellent academic preparation in Computer Graphics, image processing, distributed processing, or other related fields
Interest and talent in large-scale geo data processing and 3D visualization
Experience using C++, Microsoft Visual Studio, and related software development toolkits and utilities.
Excellent writing and communication skills, including technical documentation and oral presentations

Other beneficial experience:
Experience and aptitude for scripting languages (such as Python, Tcl, Perl)
Independent research or previous internship
Teaching experience

Benefits

As a small technology company, we offer a highly flexible work environment and many opportunities for professional growth and advancement. You will be working with globally recognized leaders in the fields of simulation, 3D GIS, and spatial data processing.

Terrasim, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Our Company is committed to equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

We have several internship opportunities on our Market Research and Data Analytics teams. The Market Research and Data Analytics Interns will be responsible for performing data analyses to derive insight, patterns, and correlations from Hallmark’s data and other external data that can inform revenue growth opportunities, identify cost avoidance opportunities, and shape strategy. Analysis will include applying qualitative and quantitative data methods, database development, some data mining techniques. The analyses will need to be translated into key insights and interpretive summaries where easily interpreted by decision makers leveraging a variety of visual approaches. Project work may include:

Market research regarding category relevancy: determining how we identify people who might take up card sending in a bigger way.
Knowledge management: how to develop a source for getting people to the right information faster by how we architect the site/environment.
Research for a specific retailer in support of a contract renewal, which requires analysis of customer/shopper data combined with market research.
Modern Greetings Experience (MGE) consumer response, which would require analysis of qual and quant data
Some deep-dive analysis into Hallmark’s store segmentation applications to develop a well-documented algorithm to identify store clusters, identify key characteristics for those store clusters, and communicate results to partners throughout the business.
Building a user friendly tool to better visualize pre-existing consumer profile reports so that users can better utilize a self-service tool.

Full Job Description Join us today and make a difference in people's lives.

LivaNova is a global medical technology company built on decades of experience and a relentless commitment to improve the lives of patients around the world. As a worldwide leader in cardiovascular and neuromodulation solutions, we are dedicated to helping create meaningful products and therapies that transform lives each and every day. LivaNova is also dedicated to the highest standards, and we operate at the topmost level of business ethics and compliance.

Our data scientist intern will build analytics capabilities applied to revenue-generating areas like markets and competitive analysis, new drug entrants, CRM efficiencies, and reimbursement strategies.

The primary focus for this role will be in applying data science techniques to the commercial business. The intern will apply data cleaning, visualization, and statistical modeling approaches to a range of data from both internal and external sources. This person will be responsible for preparing and synthesizing data, analyzing and generating insights and solutions, and documenting / communicating their processes. In addition to the technical side of this work there will be an emphasis on data science communication to a range of audiences and stakeholders.

About You

A strong candidate does not necessarily need to have all of the following, and we encourage you to apply if you can bring other skills and perspectives to the table

An undergraduate or masters level understanding of mathematics, computer science, statistics, or machine learning

Experience applying various analytical and modeling approaches to real world problems and writing documentation and summary reports of your approaches and findings

Passion for data and for working through complex details of data collection, processing, and transformations

Practical understanding of how data is turned into insights that enable key business processes

Experience with data cleaning, data visualization, scientific writing, and data communication

An eagerness to learn the industry perspective, dive deep into the business context, and a drive to translate business needs into data

Creative problem-solving skills and openness to learn new approaches and technologies

Excellent organizational and time management skills

Proficiency in any of the following relevant tools: R, Python, SQL

Travel Requirements

Limited Travel less than 10% may be required.

Time Frame

12 weeks, flexible between the months of May and September

Location

Pittsburgh, PA preferred, but Houston, TX or remote available

LivaNova values equality and celebrates diversity: we are committed to ensuring our recruitment process and procedures are fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.
Out selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of the candidate's sex, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, color, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree, to a payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Full Job Description About our group:
The Enterprise Products, Customer Firmware and Joint Qual team works with both customer facing teams and internal firmware engineering teams to release hard drive code for specific customers, quickly determine solutions to customer issues and integrate firmware features for specific customers.

About the role - you will:
This position provides the candidate with experience in code development, bench testing on hardware and developing tools to improve how the team quickly and efficiently test and release customer hard drive code. This position is a unique opportunity to work on firmware and software development in a customer-focused team. The position reports directly to the Senior Engineering Manager.

Be part of a team that closely works with Seagate's internal customer team and the larger Firmware organization too.
Assist engineers in improving tools and quickly solving customer issues.
Assist with the design and development of tools using Python and JavaScript and with embedded hard drive firmware in C
Learn Agile methodology to development solutions collaboratively and efficiently.

About you:
Pursuing a degree in the field of computer science, engineering or math and must be returning to school in fall 2022.
Working knowledge of the Python, JavaScript and C programming language.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Must be highly motivated, self-managing and a quick study.
A team player who enjoys working as part of a team of engineers

Your experience includes:
Basic understanding of PC architecture.
Able to work independently as well as contribute as a team member
Agile knowledge and experience

Colorado's 2021 Equal Pay for Equal Work Act (SB 19-085) requires we inform you of the estimated base hourly range for this position: $18-33. Actual range is based on fair market value of the role in the geography in which you live based on the requirements of the job and your skills. This posted salary range is a good faith and reasonable estimate, and Seagate reserves the right to adjust this range depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate.

Seagate offers comprehensive benefits to its eligible employees; including, but not limited to, medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, annual variable pay bonus, 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, flexible and dependent care spending accounts, health care spending account, flexible time off/vacation, paid holidays and paid parental leave.

Location:
Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.

Interns typically work Monday through Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

Full Job Description Reality Labs (RL) focuses on delivering Meta's vision through Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR). The compute performance and power efficiency requirements of Virtual and Augmented Reality require custom silicon. The Silicon Team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body. Our chips will enable AR and VR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughout the day. We believe the only way to achieve our goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture, to firmware and algorithms.

We are seeking an intern to carry out performance modeling and architectural exploration of silicon for computer vision. In this role, you will partner with architects and chip designers. We expect that you have experience in building performance models and exposure to heterogeneous hardware architectures.

Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.

Carry out performance & power architecture exploration through detailed modeling and analysis of one or more of the following functions/components: customer compute components, shared interconnect in a heterogeneous, multi-agent system, and shared cache/memory subsystem in a heterogeneous multi-agent system
Understand the tradeoffs between general purpose and custom compute mechanisms
Understand the data flow paths, working set sizes, access patterns of different general purpose vs. custom compute components
QoS, latency and throughput analysis for heterogeneous platforms consisting of multiple agents with competing resource requirements

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering in the field of Computer Architecture or a related field
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Experience in computer architecture through coursework
Experience in software design abilities with experience in C++
Experience in performance modeling and architectural exploration methodologies
Experience in hardware power, performance and area trade offs

Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Experience in the analysis and exploration of heterogeneous multi-agent platforms
Research or industry experience in computer architecture and performance modeling
Demonstrated ability to tackle and solve challenging architectural problems
Experience with computer vision or imaging algorithms/workloads

We win wherever we go – Voted a 2019 and 2020 Computerworld Best Places to Work in IT

Full Job Description We are CyberForce|Q and we protect the cyber realm as a collective force for good. For over 25 years we have provided innovative cybersecurity solutions to our clients. Our TEAM is growing, and we are looking for an aspiring cybersecurity professional to join us! What You’ll Do Actively respond to real-world cyber-attacks. Triage incoming tickets to the SOC. Work with best-of-breed vendor technologies. Work with SIEM & SOAR platforms. Interact regularly with business owners, CISO's, and vendors as needed to see tickets through resolution. Collaborate with other IT security professionals to provide exceptional support and problem resolution as a member of our SOC. Participate in team initiatives. Schedule Our SOC operates 24x7x365. Part-time team members must work a minimum of 24 hours a week. We will find out your scheduling restrictions (i.e. class schedules, professional groups and other obligations) and the schedule will be built around your availability and the team's needs for coverage. Shifts do not rotate and do not change weekly. Location The Operations Manager will work with you to determine when it makes sense to work onsite or remote. You must live within a reasonable distance to travel to our Plymouth, MI headquarters. Candidates applying who do not reside in Michigan will not be considered for this role. What You Bring to the TEAM Ability to easily and effectively communicate technical information, written or verbally. Desire to work as a part of a highly interactive team; regularly communicating with other team members and clients. Ability to stay calm under pressure. Ability to manage time effectively and complete projects on time. Ability to differentiate between a significant event, a true positive, and a false positive. Understanding of OSI model and ability to apply to troubleshooting issues. Knowledge of networking, packet flow, TCP/UDP traffic, and firewalls. Modem, router, reliable internet and dedicated workspace at home to support remote work. Things We Love to See But Aren't Requirements Ability to write scripts/code using Python, Perl, PowerShell, or an equivalent language. Studying for or achieved certifications such as CompTIA Security+, Cisco CCNA, or Certified HIPAA Security Professional (CHSP) Technical help desk, technical troubleshooting, or information security role experience. Pursuing or completed Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Defense, Cybersecurity or a related discipline from an accredited institution. Splunk or Qradar knowledge/experience. Why Join Us 100% Cybersecurity Focus. Our company’s mission and services are purely cybersecurity. Upgrade Your Skills. As a member of our security operations, you’ll gain exposure to many networks and tools as well industry professionals inside and outside of CFQ. Grow Your Career. Join our team in an entry level role and work towards cybersecurity analyst skills. Team members that excel in this role may be eligible to join our team full-time. You are in the driver's seat of your own career development! Get School Credit. This role can fulfill internship requirements. Please contact your college or university directly to determine if our role can satisfy your internship requirement. position: Technology Summer Internship Program: Cloud Engineer I (June 2022)
description:
Full Job Description Description

Technology Summer Internship Program

Calling all emerging technologists!

Looking to gain practical, hands-on experience in the field of software engineering? The Technology Summer Internship Program is a critical program within Technology Services that helps passionate early career professionals gain real-world exposure to ground breaking technology.

Cloud Engineer Intern

Cloud Engineer Interns work alongside engineers to help modernize the way Citizens stores and accesses data. Working in a collaborative environment, interns will enhance engineering expertise while helping to seize opportunities for cloud implementation.

The Cloud Engineer Intern will:
Help to support the implementation of cloud-based solutions throughout the organization.

Offer technical support to cloud-based solutions end-users and partners.

Assist with monitoring the performance of cloud applications and solutions; analyzing opportunities for improvement.

Note: this internship program begins in early June 2022

Experience during the program

In this 10-week program, interns will gain a strong understanding of Technology Services at Citizens. This program also provides mentorship, exposure to senior leadership, and participation in a variety of activities to further develop professional skills, including:

Orientation with all Technology Services interns

Professional development workshops (such as Personal Branding and Communicating with Impact)

Social activities (such as sporting events and a bank-wide intern BBQ)

Dedicated community service activities

Life after the program

High-performing interns interested in pursuing a career in Technology Services will have an opportunity to interview for the Technology Development Program (TDP) before the summer ends. The TDP is a full-time program that helps rising professionals build a meaningful career within software, network/systems, data or cloud engineering.

Qualifications

Basic qualifications:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Development, or other technology-related degree

Expected graduation date of May 2023

Minimum GPA 3.0

Solid understanding of one or more of the following programming languages, frameworks, libraries and data formats: Java, JavaScript, C, Python, .Net, Node, SQL

Demonstrated ability to operate in a team environment; good interpersonal and communication skills

Preferred qualifications:
Previous professional exposure to software development and/or engineering

Experience with CICD pipeline (CircleCI, Jenkins, or equivalent) preferred

AWS/AZURE/GCP experience preferred

Understanding of the banking industry, specifically the functions of custodial and consumer banking

Please note that U.S. Immigration sponsorship or work visa is not available for this position and candidates must have permanent authorization to work in the U.S.

Why work with us

As one of the region’s largest banks, we’re known for our innovative spirit and friendly environment. And the people we work with are why we come to work every day. Because here, skills are honed, experience is one of a kind, and ambition is rewarded. You can train with Wall Street veterans and FinTech innovators; perform on live projects that impact results; run with your ideas and give back to your community.

Awards we've received

Forbes World's Best Banks (2020)

Forbes Best Employers for Diversity (2020)

Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality – 100% Corporate Equality Index (2020)

Military Friendly Employer (2020)

Dave Thomas Foundation – Best Adoption-friendly Workplace (2020)

Diversity, Inc. – Top 25 companies for diversity (2019)

Forbes Best Employers for New Grads (2019)

Hours and Work Schedule

Hours per Week: 40

Work Schedule: M-F 8:30am - 5pm

Why Work for Us

At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

description:

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

Full Job Description Job Description

At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurement and make a difference in the world.This internship position is with Keysight’s Semiconductor Infrastructure Solutions (SIS) organization. We are the world leader in design and manufacture of laser interferometry systems, precision optical components, complex monolithic optics (CMOs), and advanced electronic measurement solutions. Our systems offer the high precision in a wide dynamic range, the ability to simultaneously measure positions with multiple degrees of freedom, and the highest accuracy available in both air and vacuum environments. We are seeking and selecting an intern from college student to join our Optics Manufacturing Engineering team. The selected candidate will be part of a team which closely works with our R&D and NPI teams to introduce new products to our advanced optics and interferometer production. You will have opportunities to work with experienced engineers to learn and adapt new technologies, developing technical knowledge and leadership to drive our NPI process and deliver the products to market. As an intern of Manufacturing Engineer you will be responsible to collect our optical coating production data, carry out data analysis and release new coating data processing or product for our next generation metrology product and systems which include assemblies of optics coating, precision mechanics, polarizing optics, fiber optics, and electronics.

Responsibilities:
Review and work closely with R&D and NPI teams to develop a data collection program for new optical coating manufacturing processes Perform data mining and analysis for coating process performance and design review, ensuring coating designs workable for manufacturing, communicating feedback to R&D to ensure best overall product solution Participate, drive, and make proto optical coatings to verify various coating designs and processes, including early stage of optical coating measurement, coating fixture design, test station setup and evaluation
Job Qualifications

Skills and Knowledge Qualifications

Major or study in Mechanical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Materials, or Computer Science toward B.Sc or M.Sc. Hands-on work or project from programming and data analysis using various simulation tools such as MatLab, Python, C or C++, Excel Able to think and act independently to present ideas and new concepts into very engineering groups Use of CAD simulation tools is a plus Excellent communication and ability to work in team environment with people at all levels

Full Job Description Website Application Developer Intern We are currently looking for enthusiastic and skilled Website Application Developer Interns to join our Product development department and provide creative ideas and development work to help achieve specific aviation product goals. We currently build software for the aviation industry on both the B2B and B2C consumer categories. Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee. You will also be working as a full-stack website application developer in our Product development department and closely with the marketing and design departments and times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the designing of the company's various software products. You will gain real hands-on working with many aspects of the product on the front-end and back-end. We are looking for someone who is very positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”. You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives. Responsibilities Design, build, maintain clean, and clever Mean Stack codes Work with the popular CMS WordPress Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of web applications Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems Work with the company's AI department and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the company’s web applications Apply understandings of web and mobile web app (Mean Stack) Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the web applications You will spend a lot of your time building web apps, efficiently coding in Mean Stack. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes Work with the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable. Requirements You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts Previous experience with javascript, Angular, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and Java Previous working experience with WordPress. Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of web development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning Developing proficiency in Angular (v7 or higher), Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, Git, Postman, GitHub, AWS, PHP, Laravel, Rest/Restful, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build our web apps. Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor. Loves to learn new things about programming each day. This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment. This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time position. Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public and commercial markets with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. We help clients address their toughest challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures with a focus on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit: www.guidehouse.com.

Responsibilities

As an employee in the Financial Services segment at Guidehouse, you will join a team of professionals who combine technical expertise with business pragmatism to support clients including approximately 300 financial services companies; 8 of the Top 10 largest banks in the U.S.; all of the Big 5 banks in Canada; federal financial regulators and lending agencies; and top U.S. and international law firms. You will have a unique opportunity to develop your skills in a variety of areas while working in a collaborative team environment to provide our clients with innovate solutions to their most pressing problems.

Our consultants perform a wide range of functions including but not limited to:

Analytics and Problem Solving – perform critical, value-add work that can directly impact our clients’ bottom line.
Client Service and Project Management – work on challenging, mission critical engagements in a collaborative setting to deliver results that exceed client expectations.
Practice and Business Development – participate in a variety of practice initiatives (e.g., recruiting, people and culture, internal communications, and training) and assist senior practitioners in the pursuit of new business opportunities.
Industry Knowledge and Development – expand your industry knowledge, develop core consulting capabilities and learn to effectively articulate our competitive differentiators to clients.

As an Intern, you will gain first-hand consulting experience working on a variety of projects with different engagement teams. Your daily tasks will vary and may include analyzing account / transaction histories, performing research, evaluating processes, risks and controls and preparing project status updates.

Qualifications

Graduating with an undergraduate degree between December 2022 and June 2023 with a business-related or technical major (e.g. Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Management, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics).
Demonstrated solid academic performance, with a 3.2 GPA or better.
Working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint programs.
Strong research and analytical skills.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Demonstrated initiative, adaptability, creative problem-solving skills and an ability to work well with teams.

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Full Job Description JT4 provides engineering and technical support to multiple western test ranges for the U.S. Air Force and Navy under the Joint Range Technical Services Contract, better known as J-Tech II. We develop and maintain realistic integrated test and training environments, and prepare our nation's war-fighting aircraft, weapons systems, and aircrews for today's missions and tomorrow's global challenges.

JOB SUMMARY - ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES

Seasonal hire, selected for achievement and potential in a scientific college curriculum. Each Intern will be placed under the direct supervision of a JT4 mentor, and be provided hands-on participation in ongoing projects to the greatest extend possible. Opportunities include but are not limited to Real Time Programming (C, VxWorks); mathematical algorithm development (MatLab); Object Oriented Developmental programming (in C++ and/or Java), and EE tasking in a variety of applications (mostly radar associated). Tasking is at entry level, to include the following:

1. Conducts research and reference reading to assist higher-level engineers in obtaining technical information; keeps informed of currently approved standards, codes, and procedures applied to engineering specialty.
2. Performs fundamental engineering tasks requiring standard techniques such as tolerance studies and design calculations.
3. Plans and carries out successive engineering steps and resolves technical problems by standard practices and techniques.
4. Supports projects with limited scope or parts of more complex projects with detailed instructions on the intent and scope of the documents to be prepared.
5. Studies currently approved standards, codes, and procedures applied to the engineering specialty.
6. Assists in preparation of reports, correspondence, or technical studies.
7. Performs all other position-related duties as assigned or requested.

OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES
Each employee must read, understand, and implement the general and specific operational, safety, quality, and environmental requirements of all plans, procedures, and policies pertaining to their job.

WORKING CONDITIONS
Most positions involve work typical of office environment with no unusual hazards. There is occasional lifting to 20 pounds. Constant sitting with routine use of computer terminal. Constant use of sight abilities while reviewing documents use of speech/hearing abilities for communications. Routine travel to remote Company work locations may be required.

REQUIREMENTS - EDUCATION, TECHNICAL, AND WORK EXPERIENCE
The incumbent must have a minimum of Junior Class standing and be enrolled in an accredited Bachelors' Degree program in a scientific discipline suitable for the Internship being offered (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or Computer Engineering preferred). GPA standing and course work accomplished will be considered in the selection process. Strong computer skills are desired, including MS Office applications and other COTS packages. Completed course work in EE/Computer Science/Math and any technical job/hobby experience will be considered. For EE Internships, courses in Electromagnetics and Antenna Theory are highly desirable. Must qualify for and maintain a government security clearance and must have a valid, current state driver's license.

DISCLAIMER
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of persons so classified.

Our data scientists work with key business leaders and decision makers to solve problems by mining, analyzing, and modeling data to provide insights that drive impact. The day to day includes exploratory analysis to understand data structures and relationships, research to refine a methodology, cranking out lightning fast machine learning code to create a model that predicts trends and automates validation, collaborating with cross-functional teams, or visualizing and sharing their results with executives. They are comfortable working with a variety of partners and data (structured, unstructured, streaming) in a shared code repository utilizing multiple programming languages and frameworks to deliver state of the art analytics and models in an agile environment. Understanding of statistics and machine learning models like regression (spline, ridge), SVM, tree based classification algorithms, time series modelling

Excellent written and verbal English language skills

The UX Intern may also work closely with the UX Team to assist in designing, conducting, analyzing, and reporting on user-centered research and usability testing.

You are interested in actively collaborating with a team, as well as working independently when necessary.

The User Experience Team at Santander is a part of the Digital Team that is focused on defining and guiding the experience of our digital sales and digital authenticated channels through research, strategic design, & detailed design. Our designers and researchers work hard to understand our customers and deliver digital experiences that meet their needs.

Full Job Description iOS Developer Intern We are currently looking for enthusiastic and skilled iOS Developer Interns to join our Product development department and provide creative ideas and development work to help achieve specific product goals for iOS applications in the aviation industry. Someone who is also looking for an opportunity to find a good fit with our growing company, and is seeking an opportunity to be converted into a full-time employee. You will also be working directly on the product development teams, with Design and Marketing, and at times with the president of the company who plays a large part in the overall designing of the product. You will be fully hands-on working with many aspects of the products on the front-end and back-end. We are looking for someone who is positively aggressive, creative, willing to learn new things, seeks out the new and improved, and someone who is not afraid to fail and make competent mistakes. Someone who believes that there is no proverbial "box" to begin with so never has to be asked to “think outside of the box”. You must be prepared to work with very bright and creative individuals who believe in a vision and who see themselves as a family who believe that truth, integrity, and personal wellbeing comes first and that the vision of the company is most important in their professional lives. Responsibilities Design, build, maintain clean, and clever swift codes Able to build APIs Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of iOS applications Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems Work with the company's AI team and provide insights into key Machine Learning algorithms for the product Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization of the iOS application Apply understandings of mobile, and native apps (iOS) Collaborate with other developers and designers to help define, build, and deliver new features in the iOS application You will spend a lot of your time building iOS apps, efficiently coding in Swift. This includes new feature development, architecture, writing unit tests, refactors, and bug/crash fixes Work in the development team to build basic algorithms for in-app metrics tracking and user adoption tools Share responsibilities such as app architecture/design reviews, code reviews, performance tuning, and build pipeline management Own and deliver all your tasks, small must-do tasks to larger, complex projects with many moving parts Share your opinions and help shape our technical direction, best practices, product ideas, and team processes. Your inputs are most valuable. Requirements You are pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field Solid understanding of object-oriented programming design & development concepts Previous experience with Xcode and Swift/Objective-C Strong analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced startup environment Solid coding chops, code design skills, and practitioner of mobile development best practices - including object-oriented design principles; design pattern usage; writing modular, reusable, testable code; data structures; concurrency; performance profiling and tuning Developing proficiency in Swift, Cocoa Touch, Xcode, CocoaPods, git, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build iOS apps. Developing proficiency in Java, JavaScript, Node.js, Angular (v7 or higher), PHP, Laravel, MongoDB, etc. - the skills and tools needed to build strong websites and mobile apps backend APIs. Great communicator, adaptable, supportive, hard-working, and has a great sense of humor. Loves to learn new things about programming each day. This internship will help you acquire software engineering and development skills and provide you with knowledge of aviation industry-specific engineering requirements. Ultimately, you will gain experience in conceptualizing, designing, and developing software for both B2B and B2C markets within the aviation industry and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment. This internship has no set salary, it offers other forms of compensation, such as training, experience building, and possible commission and/or bonuses and full-time employment. Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Commission pay COVID-19 considerations: To keep our Siblings safe, we will remain fully remote until a working vaccine for COVID-19 is widely available, and the country has reached herd immunity. Application Question(s): Are you able to start working remotely within 1-2 weeks? (Yes/No) If you are from a Coding Bootcamp, please enter their reference code here. God has blessed us with the resources to pay for high performance team-members. You can learn more about our organization athttps://www.wycliffeassociates.org/. This is the kind of place that rewards intensity, ambition, drive, and creativity. The Job You'll Do First, you’ll be a developer. You’ll be supporting business systems and building software tools for Bible Translation. Your work will be used globally. You’ll jump into a fast moving river of existing projects, plus have the space to help create new tools and systems for Bible translators. You’ll be responsible to understand projects at a high-level, then roll up your sleeves and write amazing code. You and your teammates will create solutions so the rest of the organization can focus on raising money, raising volunteers, equipping the nations to translate the Bible, and saving the world. You’ll propel the Bible toward universal availability. What We'll Do For You · We’ll give you a place where you can build things the way you’ve always wanted to, and make a difference in the process. · We’ll give you opportunities to grow, stretch, flex, and learn. · Teach and implement Agile/Scrum methodology · Provide software development experience guided by seasoned professionals · Create an environment to learn from mentors and each other · Have you contribute to real-world projects with meaningful impact · Enable worshipping God through your talents in fellowship with other believers Job Responsibilities And Duties · Work with a team to develop functioning software each Sprint · Submit and review Pull Requests · Write unit and automated tests · Capture and document software requirements · Create and provide estimates for User Stories · Participate in Sprint and Product planning · Participate in daily team Standup meetings Your Skills · You have experience coding in one or more of these areas · Web programming (HTML, CSS, and Javascript) · Front End (Angular, React, or Vue) · A managed or compiled language (C#, Java, or Kotlin) · A scripted or interpreted language (Ruby, Python, or Node.js) · You have used software versioning control (such as Git, Mercurial, or Subversion) in your own projects or when working with others. Your Education & Experience · You are currently enrolled as a full-time student with a Comp-Sci Major at an accredited college or university. · You’re holding an overall GPA of 3.0 or above. · If you are still in school, you are a Senior. · It would be great if you had experience with SQL Server databases. · Even better, if you had prior internship experience. Personal Qualifications · Have a personal relationship with Jesus Christ. · Should sense a call from God to ministry and have a genuine caring for people. · Should have personal warmth that invites confidence and possess a personal integrity that never forfeits the trust that is offered. · Ability to be at ease with people from diverse cultures and backgrounds. · Demonstration of the attitudes of a servant leader. · Highly self-motivated and directed. · Keen attention to detail. · Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form. · Ability to work effectively with a virtual team. · Can keep commitments. · Ability and desire to learn new technologies, improve skills, and adapt to change. Full Job Description At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people think about enterprise security technology. With our new Identity Defined Security platform, we're building a borderless world where people have total freedom to work wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.

We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that inspires our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.

We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado, and we have offices and employees around the globe. And we serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 100. Because even in the most complex enterprise environments, security shouldn't be a source of anxiety. It is one of your greatest competitive advantages.

Ping's SaaS Product Development team builds complex, microservice-based cloud applications that provide our customers with Identity and Access Management. We are looking for a Software Quality Engineer Intern to join our PingOne product development team.

Expectations:
You will build automated test scenarios in a continuous integration environment.
You will create automated test suites to validate API, backend and frontend components.
You will build test cases and test plans, and perform manual testing to find product issues in a cloud-based environment.
You will maintain and extend tools for functional testing, defect tracking and risk analysis.
You will report to the QA Manager that is overseeing the quality of the PingOne products.

Requirements:
Good problem-solving skills. Love finding the best solution.
Read / write Java code to support developing test automation and suites.
Experience in / understanding of an agile, iterative, RUP or XP environments.

Desired Qualifications:
Experience testing a SaaS or web service software
Understanding of relational DB such as SQL
Bonus: Experience working with Selenium WebDriver

Ping Identity is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.
Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.
The Experience
Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.
The Main Responsibilities

As a Technical Writer Intern in our North America Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Technician Support Center team to provide assignments, programming, and order support for Mass Markets Field Technicians Tasks during the 10 weeks will have the possibility to include leveraging creative ways to communicate, train and refresh process in a clear, concise and user-friendly manner. Technical writer interns will have the potential to write new process documents and converting legacy documents to current template. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include:

Assist with programming for internet and phone lines Create new library for team documents Partner with frontline to understand processes and systems
What We Look For in a Candidate

Education Requirements
o Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023.
o Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Business, English, Public Relations, Operations Management, Marketing Analytics, or a related field

Proficiency and understanding of:
o Well versed in technical writing, word processing applications, Sharepoint, TEAMS and Visio.
o Knowledge creating videos for communication process changes a plus.
o Microsoft suites is a must
o Lean background is a plus

Professional Attributes
o Strong drive for results and taking initiative
o Ability to be inquisitive, critical thinking, and adaptable-
o Attention to detail with strong organizational skills
o Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions
o Strong written and verbal communication skills
o Comfortability in group settings with giving presentations
o Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation.

Work Setting
o Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Remote- Work From Home
o Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August)
o Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations)

What to Expect Next

After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you!

Full Job Description We are CyberForce|Q and we protect the cyber realm as a collective force for good. For over 25 years we have provided innovative cybersecurity solutions to our clients. Our TEAM is growing, and we are looking for an aspiring cybersecurity professional to join us! What You’ll Do Actively respond to real-world cyber-attacks. Triage incoming tickets to the SOC. Work with best-of-breed vendor technologies. Work with SIEM & SOAR platforms. Interact regularly with business owners, CISO's, and vendors as needed to see tickets through resolution. Collaborate with other IT security professionals to provide exceptional support and problem resolution as a member of our SOC. Participate in team initiatives. Schedule Our SOC operates 24x7x365. Part-time team members must work a minimum of 24 hours a week. We will find out your scheduling restrictions (i.e. class schedules, professional groups and other obligations) and the schedule will be built around your availability and the team's needs for coverage. Shifts do not rotate and do not change weekly. Location The Operations Manager will work with you to determine when it makes sense to work onsite or remote. You must live within a reasonable distance to travel to our Plymouth, MI headquarters. Candidates applying who do not reside in Michigan will not be considered for this role. What You Bring to the TEAM Ability to easily and effectively communicate technical information, written or verbally. Full Job Description As a Software Developer Intern at Sandhills Global you will have the opportunity to learn the different modern tools and technologies we use to develop industry-leading software. Each intern is placed in our developer training department where you will go through a series of tasks designed to get you familiar with our processes, procedures and tech stack that we use. Many applications within the company are web-based data driven applications that utilize .NET, SQL Server, Web APIs, and front end frameworks such as javascript, jQuery, and React.js to name a few. Once through training, Software Developer Interns are placed within an agile team in an area that fits their skills and where we have a need, at which point they can put their new training and skills to work. As part of that team you will have the opportunity to be a part of a highly collaborative team that utilizes agile practices to develop real world software, whether its for improving operational efficiency for the company, developing services we sell to customers, or working on public websites that millions of users visit every month. We are primarily a Microsoft shop, and utilize technologies in that ecosystem to solve business problems. C# is our primary coding language and what we use for any new projects, but we have many mature systems that are written in VB which we maintain. There are smaller areas that utilize other languages and technology such as PHP, Swift, Objective C, and Java for example, but these are project specific and the minority. Assume other duties as assigned.
