position: User Experience (UX) & Product Writing Intern - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.
Internships at TikTok aim to provide students the chance to work with our clients and teams to address key business problems and identify areas of growth for the company. With your education and experience, you will be able to take on real-world challenges from day one.

By applying to this position, your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Los Angeles & Mountain View, CA. This Internship Program is for 12 weeks duration beginning in May/June 2022.

Application deadline: February 15th, 2022
Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all campus jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.

About the team:
We're looking for interns to join our UX and Product Writing teams! Interns will collaborate closely with members of the TikTok Product Management, Design, Marketing, User Research, Engineering, and Localization teams to build products that captivate and engage our viewers and content creators.
As an advocate for our users, you'll use design thinking, empathy, and data to help shape and refine our product and identify opportunities to build better experiences for our users.

Opportunities are available with the following teams:
UX Writing Technical Writing UX Localization Operations Help Center Content Strategy
Responsibilities:
UX Writing Intern
Learn and apply TikTok's style guidelines, glossary guidance, and component patterns to write and edit UI text that helps users navigate our products, including work on: onboarding, feature naming, promos, product tours, error messages, instructional materials Lead content audits to identify opportunities and drive consistency across the product Collaborate on projects and optimize features over time with multiple stakeholders Understand how to balance business requirements and customer needs in building products Work with writers across teams to define a cohesive narrative across all experiences
Technical Writing Intern
Learn and apply technical documentation guidelines to write and edit technical documentation Proofread and edit content written by others to ensure completeness, accuracy, and clarity Audit content for accuracy and to drive consistency across documentation Attend demos and meetings to stay informed on functionality enhancements and modifications Gather feedback from the designer and developer community to iterate on content
UX Localization Operations Intern
Work closely with UX Localization Operations manager and with both UX Writing and Localization teams to help manage U.S. translation projects and requirements to ensure timely delivery Learn and apply U.S. project localization processes and guidelines Help audit and review UI strings and respond to vendor translation queries Support content audits to identify opportunities and drive consistency across the product Add terminology and phrases to the UX writing and localization glossary
Help Center Content Strategy Intern
Learn and apply TikTok's support content guidelines to things like help center articles, support content, and other help-related materials Ability to write in a clear, helpful, approachable, and empathetic way Edit existing content to ensure that it aligns with TikTok's voice and content standards Work closely with teams to identify top issues and help determine the appropriate messaging strategy to address customer concerns Use data to measure and optimize the quality and usefulness of content Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Communication, Computer Science, English, Instructional Design, Journalism, Linguistics, Project Management, Technical/Business Writing, UX, HCI, or a related field Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship Able to commit to working for 12 weeks during Summer 2022 Experience with UX, writing and editing online or technical content for both internal and external audiences (even better if you have a writing portfolio to share!) Strong interest in social app products, user and influencer behavior, and associated trends Knowledge of HTML/CSS/Markdown language or mobile platforms (such as Android, iOS) and familiarity with desktop tools or game engines (such as Adobe, Unity) Experience defining, tracking, and reporting on metrics Knowledge of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Exceptional communication and organizational skills Self-starter who can problem solve and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Job Summary

Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG’s internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG Long Island is seeking a Vegetation Management Technical intern at our Hicksville location.

The Vegetation Management GIS intern will provide technical and training support to Vegetation Management staff and assist in the production of GIS resources for the division, which is currently engaged in several projects for field data collection and analysis. The intern will gain experience in applying GIS solutions and tools to real-world logistical problems and working with a team to implement them.

Job Responsibilities

The job duties include, but not limited to the following:
Troubleshooting technical issues for department users on the ArcGIS platform
Assist in migrating to latest versions of ESRI cloud and mobile platforms
Help writing role documentation and user guides

Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution in GIS, geography, geomatics, geology, ecology, forestry, sociology, urban studies, electrical engineering, environmental studies, computer engineering or computer science.
At least one full semester course in GIS
Experience with desktop GIS Software
Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. At least one full Semester course in GIS. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Two semesters experience with ArcMAP Desktop (preferably 10.1 or above)
Previous work with ArcGIS Online Feature Services, ESRI's Collector and/or Web App Builder, or other previous web mapping experience

Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions

position: 2022 Summer Internship - Geographical Information Systems (GIS) Analyst - TCLW
description:
Full Job Description Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) is a leading international mining company with headquarters in Phoenix, Arizona. FCX operates large, long-lived, geographically diverse assets with significant proven and probable reserves of copper, gold and molybdenum.

Freeport-McMoRan’s internship program has been referred to as one of the top programs in the mining industry. By providing access to top minds and technology in mining today, our structured internship will provide you the skills and experience to help prepare you for a successful career. Our internship program is tailored to full-time students currently enrolled at an accredited four-year university and recent graduates in North America. Internships are temporary full-time paid positions and typically run from May through August.

Please note: This internship has the potential to work remotely up to 100% of the time and may require occasional travel to the Phoenix corporate offices and/or site locations. This position may be performed anywhere in the U.S. except California, Illinois, Michigan, New Hampshire, New York as well as other states based on business factors.

Description

Under general supervision, performs project work that assists the Tailings, Crushed Leach and Water (TCLW) Geospatial Group.

May assist with geospatial data management tasks for efficient use of incoming imagery, survey data and other remote sensing data types
May develop workflows and tools to automate geospatial data management tasks
May assist with developing maps and apps to visualize and query engineering datasets related to Tailings, Crushed Leach and Water Facilities
Provides assistance and support for departmental projects and tasks as needed
Perform other duties as required
Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:
Full-time student currently enrolled at an accredited four-year university majoring in Computer Science, Geography, Remote Sensing or closely related field, OR
Recent college graduate having graduated within 12 months prior to internship start date with a degree in Computer Science, Geography, Remote Sensing or closely related field
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Possesses strong data analysis and problem-solving skills
Highly accurate and detail oriented
Possesses strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrates initiative, organizational skills and ability to work well under pressure
Demonstrates ability to collaborate and work effectively in a team environment

Preferred Qualifications:
Proficient in the use of ESRI ARCGIS applications and software
Familiarity with Satellite Remote Sensing Technology and/or Imagery Analysis
Basic programming skills and/or familiarity with one or more languages such as (Python, JavaScript, R, etc.)

Criteria/Conditions:
Ability to understand and apply verbal and written work and safety-related instructions and procedures given in English
Ability to communicate in English with respect to job assignments, job procedures, and applicable safety standards
Must be able to work in a potentially stressful environment
Work is in an office, mine, or manufacturing plant setting, which may include exposure to extremes in temperature and humidity, moving mechanical parts, risk of electrical shock, toxic chemicals, explosives, fumes or airborne particles.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, sit, demonstrate manual dexterity, climb stairs and ladders, work on elevated platforms, talk, hear and see.
Occasionally may be required to lift moderately heavy objects up to (30) pounds during the course of the workday.
Personal protective equipment is required when performing work in a mine, outdoor, manufacturing or plant environment, including hard hat, hearing protection, safety glasses, safety footwear, and as needed, respirator, rubber steel-toe boots, protective clothing, gloves and any other protective equipment as required.

Freeport-McMoRan has reviewed the jobs at its various office and operating sites and determined that many of these jobs require employees to perform essential job functions that pose a direct threat to the safety or health of the employees performing these tasks or others. Accordingly, the Company has designated the following positions as safety-sensitive:

Site-based positions, or positions which require unescorted access to site-based operational areas, which are held by employees who are required to receive MSHA, OSHA, DOT, HAZWOPER and/or Hazard Recognition Training; or
Positions which are held by employees who operate equipment, machinery or motor vehicles in furtherance of performing the essential functions of their job duties, including operating motor vehicles while on Company business or travel (for this purpose “motor vehicles” includes Company owned or leased motor vehicles and personal motor vehicles used by employees in furtherance of Company business or while on Company travel); or
Positions which Freeport-McMoRan has designated as safety sensitive positions in the applicable job or position description and which upon further review continue to be designated as safety-sensitive based on an individualized assessment of the actual duties performed by a specifically identified employee.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability

Full Job Description ArcherHall is growing fast. We’re seeking exceptionally motivated individuals looking to gain valuable experience in the digital forensics industry to be a part of our internship program. Interns will assist with the forensic examinations of computers, networks, mobile devices, and other digital media in support of our clients’ civil, criminal, or internal investigations. General duties include: Assisting in-lab, on-site and remote collections and investigations using a variety of forensic tools such as Cellebrite, Axiom, XWays, FEX, FTK, EnCase and other forensic software. Handling evidence and chain of custody forms to ensure the proper handling of evidence during litigation. Attending client meetings and updating case files. Researching forensic tools and troubleshooting technical issues. Uploading case data to e-discovery platforms such as Relativity. Keeping lab workstations updated with the latest versions of forensic software, and assisting with other lab responsibilities as needed. Interns will have the opportunity to learn from experienced digital forensics and e-discovery experts and gain exposure to a variety of tools and expertise on the team. At ArcherHall we constantly seek to push the envelope and get to the next level. Our Digital Forensics Division places a strong emphasis on both internal and external training and professional development, and the ideal candidate will be willing to try new things, continuously seeking opportunities to learn, and be eager to support their colleagues through challenges. Qualities of the ideal candidate : Dependable. High level of personal accountability and takes responsibilities seriously. Meticulous and conscientious. Understands how their work impacts others, and strives to do an exceptional job for the team and the client. Low ego. Not above taking on any task if it’s necessary for the success of the team. Driven. Excited about being part of a fast-growth company and building something great. position: Product Package Standardization Project Manager (Intern Position)
description:
Full Job Description Colibri Group
Colibri Real Estate Project Manager
Product Package Standardization Project Manager (Intern Position)
St. Louis, MO
(Westport / Creve Coeur Area)

At Colibri, culture is a critical part of our collective success, and we live our values everyday: Love, Joy, Boldness, Teamwork and Curiosity. These values guide our interactions with each other, our customers, and the community as a whole.

Responsibilities:
Colibri Group, a St. Louis based organization, is looking for an MBA intern to take on an important and exciting project that will have great enterprise impact. If you are high energy, ambitious, and eager to add to your skill set- this project is for you. In this role you will manage the implementation plan for our educational product package standardization across our family of brands that will result in a unified ‘One Real Estate” customer experience.

This position requires the candidate to work with a variety of people in various roles, such as business unit leaders, product managers, marketing, learning & development, content management, regulatory, sales, support and platform management. The candidate needs to be well organized and have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, having the lead execution responsibility for the ‘getting products to standards’ plan.

This person will document and coordinate stakeholder deliverables, and upon completion the candidate will have the opportunity to present their findings to the senior leadership team; a wonderful opportunity for development and exposure.

Develop and manage a detailed project schedule and work plan to execute the application of our product standardization across brands. to future-state inventory.
Manage and coordinate dependencies across disciplines and adjust the plan as needed.
Measure, document and mitigate risks associated with the implementation plan.
Across the business, need to identify the stakeholders and respective RACI alignment.
Maintain clear and concise communication with all stakeholders, including business owners, product owners, regulatory and platform management.
Collaborate with Head of Regulatory to ensure the strategy, planning and execution to efficiently secure necessary approvals.
In partnership with Corporate Communications, proactively and routinely update the RE leadership team and customers on strategy, plan and progress toward Colibri One product standards migration.
Plan for and execute to formalize, train and govern our new package future state.
Build a scorecard that measures the effectiveness of the new content.

Skills and Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, or a related field or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification required
2-3 years of project management and related experience
Proven ability to solve problems creatively
Strong familiarity with project management software tools, methodologies, and best practices
Experience seeing projects through the full life cycle
Excellent analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills and extremely resourceful
Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline

Employment Details
Position is approximately 10-15 hours weeks
Intern period September 7, 2021, to November 5, 2021, with a final read out /recommendations presented in Mid-November.
$30 per hour with a bonus of up to $3000 paid upon project competition.

Required Education and Experience:
Ideal candidate will be enrolled in or a recent graduate of an MBA program.

About Colibri Group
Colibri provides learning solutions to help individuals obtain professional licensure, maintain their standing with continuing education and upskill through professional development to be the best in their fields. Through a collection of brands, we serve over 1,000,000 professionals each year within the Real Estate, Healthcare, Financial Services and Appraisal industries, among others.

Full Job Description Job Description

At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurement and make a difference in the world.

Keysight is the world's leading electronic measurement company, helping scientists and engineers address their toughest technical challenges. Our employees leverage their insight, passion and creations to deliver measurement solutions in wireless communications, aerospace and defense, automotive, energy and semiconductor markets with world-class platforms, software and measurement science. The company’s over 12,000 employees serve customers in more than 100 countries.

As market leaders, we are at the heart of the technology revolution. We help our customers accelerate their innovations to connect and secure the world anywhere, anytime with any information – voice, data, video, and whatever they can imagine next.

Job Description:
As a R&D FPGA engineering intern at Keysight, you will join a high-performance R&D team located primarily in Santa Rosa, CA. Our team is part of Keysight’s central research and development organization, Keysight Laboratories. We help to create, validate, and implement next generation technology that differentiates Keysight products from the competition. Your focus will be on designing FPGA gateware for embedded systems and/or complex measurement solutions.

Working towards a BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science. Experience coding, synthesizing and simulating Verilog and/or VHDL RTL implementations in FPGA Self-motivated, quick-learner and excellent analytical skills Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills Must be flexible, adaptable and eager to push technical boundaries Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Experience with the latest FPGA tool flows and design methodologies Digital signal processing (DSP) knowledge Experience with electronic test and measurement equipment

position: SAP Mobile iXp Intern - Mobile Integration Developer
description:
Full Job Description What we offer

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

About the SAP Internship Experience Program
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

SAP Mobile Experience and Engineering(MxE) team is developing next-generation complex mobile applications for S/4HANA and other SAP business solutions, using SAP Business Technology Platform(BTP). The team uses an agile/scrum development process and test-driven development approach, with emphasis on continuous integration, unit testing, and peer reviews. We are looking for an Intern who takes initiative, is ready to learn, and shows interest in mobile integration to join the backend integration development team at the Chicago, Illinois location, for the development of reusable integration services for mobile applications and cloud solutions.

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP Mobile iXp Intern – Mobile Integration Developer
Location: Chicago, IL – Please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings
Expected start date to end date: November / December 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Work in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, including analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging, documentation, and deployment
Work with other mobile team engineers to collaborate and share best practices
Ability to work independently as well as with the team
Ability to understand and master new technologies quickly
Test software in accordance with SAP’s testing standards as defined in the unit test plans
Provide support to quality assurance and consulting services as needed
Full Stack Development: Develop both frontend and backend tasks, Test, Maintenance, and Support
Get involved with SAP’s active Intern Community and experience what it is like to be early talent at one of the biggest software companies in the World
Innovate and create new tools that will help SAP run simple

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning
A minimum of 60 credit hours working towards a BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related fields
Candidates should have a current 3.0 or higher GPA
Solid background in computer software development fundamentals and technologies (algorithms and data structures, on-device memory management, user interface development, design patterns, data transfer protocols, software engineering, multi-tier application architectures, etc.)
Strong programming skills in at least one of the programming languages: ABAP OO, Java, Javascript, Python, Node.js, Swift
Good knowledge of SQL programming and Data Modelling
Skills in iOS or Android development is a plus
Some school projects or GitHub projects will be great to see
Open-minded, curious, self-driven, results-oriented team player
Willingness to learn and research new concepts and technologies
Fluent English language skills both in speaking and writing are a must

Knowledge of any of the following is a plus:
Databases (SAP HANA, Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, SQL Anywhere, ASE, MySQL, etc.)
ABAP development skills, Swift, Objective-C, C++, JavaScript or Kotlin
SAP Products & Solutions (SAP NetWeaver, SAP Business Suite, SAP BusinessObjects, etc.)

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

SAP DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

We are SAP

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Full Job Description We are looking for a creative and knowledgeable TM developing engineer in Santa Clara, California. NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing — with the GPU acting as the brains of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

We need a creative individual who will help transfer GPU, Tegra and Automotive products from design engineering to mass production. You will be exposed to various aspects of building and testing NVIDIA products, from GPU/Tegra/Automotive to assembled boards. In addition, your responsibilities will include working with overseas manufacturing teams to increase yields, test coverage and capacity, and reduce production costs. If you are passionate about building the highest quality server products that will change the world, then we really want to hear from you.

What you’ll be doing:
Developing and maintain our ATE automation tools in Perl and Python

MySQL database maintenance

PHP coding for web service that visualize our Pattern Robustness data

Developing Test Methods on Advantest 93000 tester with C/C++.

Working with test engineer to develop and debug TM codes that used to test our GPU/Tegra chips.

What we need to see:
Pursuing a BS or MS in computer science or electrical engineering

Adept programming skill in Perl/Python

Knowing C++ programming is a plus

MySQL database knowledge

Knowing Linux OS and shell commands

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Knowledge of VLSI/ASIC

Scan and BIST knowledge of IC testing

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people on the planet working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
